name: 02-Data Dictionary
content:
Data Dictionary

The project integrates multiple datasets — Route Data, Weather Data, and Market Risk Data — to evaluate and optimize routing decisions. Together, these datasets provide a comprehensive view of transportation efficiency, cost, and associated risks.


1. Route Data

  • Start_Location: Specifies the origin point of a route segment.
  • End_Location: Specifies the destination point of a route segment.
  • Distance_km: Distance between Start_Location and End_Location, measured in kilometers.
  • Travel_Time_hr: Estimated travel time for the route segment, expressed in hours.
  • Route_Cost: Total cost of traveling between locations. Includes fuel, tolls, and other expenses.

2. Weather Data

  • Start_Weather_Risk: Weather risk score (0–1) at the Start_Location
  • Higher values indicate greater risk from adverse weather (e.g., storms, heavy rainfall).
  • End_Weather_Risk: Weather risk score (0–1) at the End_Location.
  • Captures potential delays or hazards due to weather conditions.

3. Market Risk Data

  • Start_Market_Risk: Market risk score (0–1) at the Start_Location.
  • Represents economic or demand-based risks that could affect supply chain efficiency.
  • End_Market_Risk: Market risk score (0–1) at the End_Location
  • Higher values indicate greater market instability or demand fluctuations at the destination.

Data Preparation Steps

  1. Data Cleaning
  • Verify location consistency between Route, Weather, and Market Risk datasets.
  • Handle missing or invalid entries (e.g., undefined risk scores).

2.Feature Engineering

  • Create aggregate risk features, e.g.:
  • Avg_Weather_Risk = (Start_Weather_Risk + End_Weather_Risk) / 2.
  • Avg_Market_Risk = (Start_Market_Risk + End_Market_Risk) / 2.
  • Calculate Cost per Kilometer = Route_Cost / Distance_km

3.Integration

  • Merge datasets based on Start_Location and End_Location keys.
  • Ensure temporal alignment when risk data is time-dependent.
